Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a flat bowl-like body, a wide circular base, a short splayed nozzle, and a side-handle of vertical ring-form, mostly missing, decorated on top with grooves and loops. The discus edge is decorated with a band of ovules between moulded rings. The centre of the concave discus is missing; four subsidiary filling-holes alternate with four raised pellets near the discus edge.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q576)
